events.title: Hotel Experience 2025
events.description: Technopolis transforms into hospitality showcase with speakers from high-end hotels, resorts, architects, and designers. Runs October 18-19
events.fullDescription:
Greece's tourism industry isn't just beaches and ancient ruins—it's a sophisticated ecosystem of design, hospitality, architecture, and experience that generates billions in revenue and shapes how the world perceives the country. For two days in October, Technopolis in Gazi becomes the nerve center of this industry at Hotel Experience 2025, where high-end hotels, boutique resorts, architects, and designers gather to shape the future of Greek hospitality.

The transformation of Greek tourism over the past two decades has been remarkable. Where once dominated by all-inclusive resort complexes, the industry now celebrates design-forward boutique hotels, renovated neoclassical mansions, and contemporary properties that balance luxury with sustainability. Athens itself exemplifies this evolution—from a city visitors rushed through en route to the islands to a destination in its own right, with design hotels, rooftop bars, and cultural experiences that rival any European capital.

Hotel Experience brings together the professionals driving this transformation. Speakers from acclaimed Greek properties and international resorts share insights on everything from biophilic design principles to guest experience innovation to sustainable hospitality practices. Architects present projects that integrate contemporary design with historical preservation, showing how modern hotels can respect architectural heritage while meeting contemporary expectations. Interior designers reveal how they create spaces that feel distinctly Greek without resorting to cliché.

For professionals in the field, these two days offer essential networking and knowledge exchange. For those curious about the hospitality industry—whether aspiring hoteliers, design students, or simply design enthusiasts—the conference provides rare behind-the-scenes access to an industry that typically operates out of public view. You'll understand what goes into creating the kind of hotel room that makes guests never want to leave, how lobbies become social spaces rather than mere throughways, and why that perfect Aegean light in your hotel room might result from carefully calculated window placement and architectural orientation.

Technopolis Gazi provides atmospheric industrial-chic surroundings for these discussions. The former gasworks, with its exposed brick and soaring ceilings, offers the kind of adaptive reuse that many hotel projects emulate—respecting industrial heritage while creating functional contemporary space.

The conference runs October 18-19, starting at 10:00 AM daily. Tickets range from €20-€50 depending on access level, making professional development accessible for those entering the industry while offering premium options for established professionals. Whether you're working in hospitality, studying design, or simply fascinated by the spaces we inhabit, Hotel Experience 2025 reveals the artistry and strategy behind exceptional hospitality.

events.title: Public Service Broadcasting
events.description: UK rock innovators Public Service Broadcasting land in Athens for one night only, bringing their signature blend of music, history, and cinematic visuals...
events.fullDescription:
When a British band turns archival footage, vintage broadcasts, and historical speeches into stadium-worthy anthems, something genuinely unique is happening. Public Service Broadcasting have spent over a decade perfecting their signature blend of electronic rock, cinematic visuals, and documentary storytelling, transforming forgotten moments from history into immersive live experiences that feel like watching a film and attending a concert simultaneously.

The London-based duo of J. Willgoose, Esq. and Wrigglesworth create music that educates as much as it entertains. Their breakthrough album "The Race for Space" turned NASA mission recordings and Soviet space program archives into an electrifying tribute to the space age. Follow-up records explored Everest expeditions, Welsh mining disasters, and European history, always with the same meticulous attention to historical detail and sonic craftsmanship. They're not just making music about history; they're making history feel vital and immediate.

Live, Public Service Broadcasting are a completely different beast. What works brilliantly on record becomes transcendent on stage, where massive screens project vintage footage in sync with driving basslines, soaring guitars, and samples that make you feel like you're experiencing these historical moments firsthand. It's prog rock meets documentary cinema meets electronic music, and somehow it all makes perfect sense when you're in the room watching it unfold.

Athens gets to experience this rare phenomenon at Gazarte, one of the city's most versatile venues in the industrial-chic Keramikos neighborhood. The multi-level cultural space has become synonymous with quality international bookings, and Public Service Broadcasting represent exactly the kind of act Gazarte excels at hosting: ambitious, visually stunning, and utterly unique. The venue's main stage provides the perfect setting for PSB's audio-visual spectacle, with excellent sound and sightlines that ensure every moment lands with maximum impact.

This is Public Service Broadcasting's first Greek appearance, making it an essential night for anyone who values innovation in live music. Whether you're a fan of electronic music, rock, or simply compelling storytelling, this show offers something you won't find anywhere else. Doors open at 20:30, giving you time to grab a drink at Gazarte's excellent bar and settle in before the history lesson begins.

Don't miss this chance to see one of Britain's most inventive live acts in one of Athens' best venues. Public Service Broadcasting deliver experiences, not just concerts, and this is your opportunity to witness something genuinely special.

events.title: Dub FX and Mr. Woodnote
events.description: Australian live-looping artist Dub FX performs with British reggae artist Mr. Woodnote
events.fullDescription:
Live-looping has revolutionized solo performance, but few artists wield it as masterfully as Dub FX. The Australian beatboxer, producer, and vocalist transforms his voice and effects pedals into a full band experience, creating dense, danceable tracks layer by layer before astonished audiences. On Friday, October 18, 2025, at 9:30 PM, Dub FX brings his electrifying solo show to Fuzz Club in Exarcheia, joined by British reggae artist Mr. Woodnote for what promises to be an evening of deep bass, intricate rhythms, and pure musical wizardry.

Benjamin Stanford, performing as Dub FX, rose to international attention through street performances and YouTube videos that showcased his extraordinary technical abilities. Using only his voice, a microphone, effects pedals, and loop stations, he constructs complete songs in real-time, beatboxing complex drum patterns while singing melodies and adding bass lines, all synchronized with split-second precision. His music blends reggae, dub, hip-hop, drum and bass, and dubstep into something uniquely his own, energetic yet conscious, technically impressive yet deeply groovy. Tracks like "Flow," "Love Someone," and "Step on My Trip" have accumulated millions of streams, but they're most powerful experienced live, where the construction process becomes part of the performance art.

Mr. Woodnote, meanwhile, represents a new generation of British reggae artists honoring roots traditions while incorporating contemporary production techniques. His warm vocals and commitment to socially conscious lyrics complement Dub FX's genre-blending approach perfectly. Together, they create an evening that satisfies both heads who appreciate technical skill and dancers who simply want to move.

Fuzz Club, nestled in the anarchist-spirited Exarcheia neighborhood, provides the ideal intimate venue for this performance. This small club, known for hosting underground and alternative acts, emphasizes community and musical authenticity over commercial gloss. The €20-€25 ticket price reflects this grassroots ethos, keeping concerts accessible to students and working-class music lovers who form the neighborhood's cultural backbone.

Exarcheia itself adds dimension to the evening. Before the show, explore its cafes, bookshops, and street art; after, decompress at one of its late-night bars where conversations about music, politics, and art flow as freely as the drinks. This concert isn't just entertainment; it's an immersion in Athens' alternative cultural scene and a celebration of innovative, independent music.

Don't miss Dub FX and Mr. Woodnote at Fuzz Club. Arrive early, stay late, and witness musical alchemy in one of Athens' most culturally vibrant neighborhoods.
